page.title: 02GENERAL OUTLINE CONTINUED
page.content: The only house there, is a bungalow with a big garden. The lady that lives there lets people bring they own caravans and stay in her garden. Mostly holiday makers stay there. The first time we went to the coast road it was at low tide. The beach is quite long and covered in pebbles, exposed to wind which seems as if it's never going to end. We could walk out quite along way, except that there are some dangerous patches, of quicksand and because it is so flat the tide can come in so fast that you can be trapped and drowned. When the tide is in it can be quite rough when it is very windy it makes the waves go higher. There are some public toilets and a shelter with some seats in and a view to sea where we did some writing.
